titleStmt.title: Bridge's remains, being VIII sermons ... by that learned and judicious divine, Mr. William Bridge ...
titleStmt.author: Bridge, William, 1600?-1670.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed and are to be sold by John Hancock Senior and Junior ...,

notesStmt.note: "Designed by himself for the press, as appears by the marginal notes, except the eighth sermon, which was the last that he preached, was taken exactly in short-hand, and published by his son-in-law after they were perused by Mr. Greenhill"
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.

(from t.p.) 1. Of mans blessedness -- 2. Affections rightly placed -- 3. How to walk with God in our calling -- 4. Of good and bad company -- 5. The carnality of professors -- 6. What our work is, and how to be done -- 7. Soul resignation into the hands of God -- 8. The dignity and duty of Gods called ones.
